p: The results of volatile compounds of cold-pressed PSO from unpretreated, blanched, and microwave-heated seeds are presented in Table 3. A typical chromatogram of volatiles from the investigated pomegranate seed oil is presented in Supplementary Figure S2. Volatile compounds that can be perceived by humans have a greater influence on PSO flavor. These are the primary volatile flavor substances and constitute the characteristic flavor of PSO. The PSO samples showed varied volatile compounds belonging to the following chemical classes: alcohols, aldehydes, ketones, esters, carboxylic acids, and hydrocarbons. The groups of volatile compounds were comparable to the findings of Costa et al. [ 42] and Dun et al. [ 60] from cold-pressed pomegranate seed and peanut oils, respectively.
